question: What determined the number of trials each subject was presented with?
details: Adaptive N could include a) online exclusion of bad trials that are presented once again later, b) addition of extra trials on the basis of online subjective data quality checks, c) using a threshold based on of participants' behaviour (i.e., learning effect or attention checks), ...
choices: fixed N of trials delivered | adaptive N of trials (please explain) | Other (please explain)

question: Please provide more details your trial presentation:
details: Possible relevant information: What algorithm or circumstances determined how many trials a subject was presented with? What were the minimum/ average/ maximal number of trials any subject in your sample saw?

question: How many trials in total was each subject presented with?
details: Insert the total number of trials that one single subject was presented with (including repetition of the same trials)

question: How many (within-subjects) conditions did you include in your task?
details: Insert the number of within-subject conditions (i.e. a subject was presented with each of these conditions - not groups of participants)

question: How many trials did each condition feature?
details: Insert the number of trials per condition (that one single subject was presented with), separated by semicolon for each new condition (e.g. 30;90). Please specify the order of conditions in the further clarification field.

question: In your final analysis, how many trials, on average, did you include for each condition? (specify for one subject)
details: Insert the average N of trials that was analyzed per condition (relative to one single subject), separated by semicolon for each new condition (e.g. 23.6;88.2). Please follow the same order of conditions as in the field 5.1.3. If there are multiple groups of participants, please provide this information per group in the Further Clarification section.

question: Please specify the minimum number of trials analyzed per condition for any subject:
details: Insert the minimum N of trials which was analyzed per condition (relative to one single subject), separated by semicolon for each new condition (e.g. 21;72). Please follow the same order of conditions as in the field 5.1.3. If there are multiple groups of participants, please provide this information per group in the Further Clarification section.

question: Please specify the maximum number of trials analyzed per condition for any subject:
details: insert the maximum N of trials which was analyzed per condition, separated by semicolon for each new condition (e.g. 29;79). Please follow the same order of conditions as in the field 5.1.3. If there are multiple groups of participants, please provide this information per group in the Further Clarification section.

question: How many subjects participated in the study?
How many participants, in total, were included in the analysis, after exclusion of bad data?
How many experimental/comparison (between-subjects) groups did the study feature?
details: Number of subsets.  Input numeric value

question: How many participants did each experimental/comparison groups feature?
details: Input numeric values separated by semicolon (e.g. 15;15;15). Please specify the order of groups in the Further Clarification section.

question: Specify the order of the group
details: Input the group name in the same order with previous answer, separated by semicolon (e.g. control group; test group)

question: Which presenting software did you use to show your experimental task?
Specify software version if applicable, and software name and version if "other" was selected.
